chapters.title: Bus and cycle signs
chapters.overview: Bus and cycle signs mark dedicated corridors and priority controls for specific users.

sections.title: Bus and cycle signs essentials
sections.summary: They reduce conflict by separating traffic classes and clarifying access rights.
key_points: Do not enter restricted bus or cycle lanes unless permitted.
Read operating times because restrictions can be time-based.
Watch for buses and cyclists rejoining general traffic.
common_exam_focus: Interpreting bus lane and cycle lane permissions.
Time-plate effects on lane access.
quick_checks: When can a general traffic vehicle use a bus lane?
What checks are needed before crossing a cycle lane?

chapters.title: Direction and tourist signs
chapters.overview: Direction signs provide route guidance, destination names, and key wayfinding information.

sections.title: Direction and tourist signs essentials
sections.summary: These signs support route planning and reduce sudden manoeuvres.
key_points: Use route numbers and destinations together for confirmation.
Advance signs should drive early lane decisions.
Tourist symbols help identify attractions without distracting from safety.
common_exam_focus: Reading route numbers and destination hierarchy.
How advance direction signs reduce late decisions.
quick_checks: What should you look at first on a direction sign?
Why are advance signs important before junctions?

chapters.title: Information signs
chapters.overview: Information signs provide service, facility, and route context for safer decision-making.

sections.title: Information signs essentials
sections.summary: These signs reduce uncertainty and help with journey planning.
key_points: Information signs are guidance, but still affect safe route choices.
Combine sign information with live road conditions.
Prepare manoeuvres early when signs announce service or route changes.
common_exam_focus: Difference between information and regulatory signs.
How information signs support planning and lane choice.
quick_checks: Are information signs mandatory or advisory?
How should information signs influence your planning?

chapters.title: Level crossing signs

chapters.title: On-street parking signs
chapters.overview: Parking signs define where, when, and how vehicles may stop, wait, or park.

sections.title: On-street parking signs essentials
sections.summary: These signs prevent unsafe obstruction and keep road space available for priority use.
key_points: Always read time windows and exemptions before parking.
Markings and plates must be interpreted together.
If unclear, do not park until you verify restrictions.
common_exam_focus: Difference between waiting, loading, and parking restrictions.
How controlled times affect legal parking.
quick_checks: What should you check first before parking?
How can time plates change parking legality?

chapters.title: Speed limit signs

sections.title: Speed limit signs essentials
sections.summary: These signs help you match speed to legal limits and local risk.
key_points: A speed limit is a maximum, not a target.
You may need to drive slower for weather, traffic, or visibility.
Transition signs often appear where road character changes.
common_exam_focus: Understanding transition between limits.
Choosing safe speed below the limit when conditions worsen.
quick_checks: Does a speed limit sign mean you should always drive at that speed?
When should you drive below the posted limit?
